bibl.title: George Daly v. J.H. McGraw. Expedition Request
bibl.note: Our transcription is based on a digital image of the microfilmed original.

div1.ab: United States of America Territory of Washington
To all whom these presents shall Call Greeting. -
div1.p: Whereas demand has been made upon me by His Excellency L.T. Moody governor of the State of Oregon for the delievery of one George R Daly a fugative from Justice from the said State of Oregon being charged with the crime of Larcency committed in the County of Multinmah in said State of Oregon. Now thereof. I A. Newell Govenor of the Territory of Washington by virtue of the authority in me vestd do hereby authorize and empower said Spraque Agust named in said demand to take the said George R. Daly wherever he may be found in this Territory and transfer him to the time thereof at the expense of State of Oregon And I hereby command Territory of Washington to afford all heedful assistance for the execution of the warrant.

In whereat, I hereto out my hand and earned the Great Seal of the said Territory
to be affixed this 14 day of March AD 1884 and of the under of the United States the By the Govenor
div1.ab: W.A. Newell N.H. Owings Secretary of the Territory
